sentences.sentence: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views.

Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukA Tory MP has statedthatBoris Johnson's disastrous performance at theCBIconference was as a result of being under a great deal of stress for the last fortnight, and he thinks he needs a break.
There's only so much one human being can stand, he says.

That is the definition of someone who is not up to the job.Perhaps we should be more concerned about the doctors and health care workers risking their lives and those of their families on a daily basis, while dealing with the results of the prime minister's unforgivable handling of the pandemic.Geoff ForwardStirlingClimate catastropheI agree with Donnachadh McCarthy's article, 'The climate crisis has put all of us on the Titanic - we are, quite literally, sinking' (Voices, 21 November).Cop26was not a success.
We won't be able to limit global heating to 1.5C.

Instead we are heading for an environmental disaster.Once again world leaders, especially from richer polluting nations, have failed to do enough to tackle the climate crisis and show real support for developing countries.

Boris Johnson's climate promises never materialised and the reality is that the deal his government oversaw in Glasgow wasn't good enough.The effects of climate change will be felt around the globe with disastrous consequences of extreme weather conditions costing lives, livelihoods, loss of land, creating food shortages and resulting in evacuations, famine, migration of people, and demands for foreign financial and humanitarian aid.Many parts of the world will be uninhabitable and droughts will lead to extreme global water shortages.

It's not just animal species that will become extinct, but our own existence is at risk.Jeannette SchaelTadley, HantsOut by ChristmasSome weeks ago I made a £10 bet with my husband that Boris Johnson will be out by Christmas.
The winnings (either way) will go to a charity.

Fingers crossed.Viv PertLondonTo keep up to speed with all the latest opinions and comment sign up to our free weekly Voices Dispatches newsletter byclicking herePorcine prime ministerHas the prime minister's role as communications officer for Peppa Pig World been properly declared?Ann SmithSouthportSolar energyThe requirement for every newly built house tohave a car charging pointmay be a good idea, but why not also provide the house with solar panels to tap into the God-given energy and reduce the drain on the national grid to supply these charging points?Jonathan LongstaffBuxted, East SussexRead MorePM insists Britain 'not remotely corrupt country' amid sleaze rowBoris Johnson under pressure at Cop26 as 'huge amount' yet to be doneEU and UK are playing chicken - and we still can't get Brexit doneBoris Johnson appears to be falling apart - but when was he ever not?
| Tom PeckEditorial: Boris Johnson's social care reforms are grossly unfairDon't expect this to be the end of the battle over social care reforms | Andrew Grice

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly uncertain about this document. The writing style and content are not particularly AI-like.
